topics.body: I probably already mentioned this somewhere, but I could never get into Homestuck. In my opinion, it moves at a pace that could be described as "glacial," and I find it to be overly reliant on gimmicks.

but i still read it.

its like when you drink that soda that has a shitty taste first but the aftertaste is addictive.

so you drink the shit down punishing yourself but coming back for the addiction.

topics.body:
Here's a touching story

Happened this morning in my bedroom/laundry room. Ivy asked me if I ever think about her breasts. I said "Sure, If you had any." Then she tackles me onto the floor. Door to my room opens, in comes sister and her fiance. They stare at us for about 2.5 seconds and then they leave. Awkwardness

Also, my sister wedding is at October 28. And I'll be singing "Fly Me to the Moon" by Frank Sinatra. Trying to get Ivy to make a duet.
topics.author: 52f0834d63687261cba90300

Gamergate is STILL going on!?

Somewhere the man who made pong is crying and saying "I just wanted to make something fun"

Really though. When did the idea "videogames are supposed to be fun" die? When did this become political? 

Granted I'm not a gamer, so this whole thing seems really weird and ungodly overblown to me.
